Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior; on lip, black-figure decoration consisting of draped figure (head and arms lost; two dabs of added red on himation) to right; on far right, trace of lower part of garment of another figure; black band at top of handle zone, in which there is part of a nonsense inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "d" was added by British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0546) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
